Description:
Convenience and Country Living Combined Together
Become a part of a beautiful community and surround yourself with good country living. This pretty white weatherboard home offers you a life of convenience and low maintenance. Designed and built with a simple floorplan, this clever two bedroom home offers an open plan with a stylish finish. Flooded with crisp clean colours and smart quality appliances, this property of 902m2 offers a very flexible adventure. Run some chickens; grow some vegetables or even plant an orchard- this allotment certainly offers the space.
The generous master bedroom features a lovely bay window with loads of natural light and a walk-in-robe, whilst bedroom two offers a touch of luxury with built-in robes. The family bathroom is well proportioned and is positioned perfectly to service the entire home, whilst the European laundry is tucked away to save space in the more important living zones. Complete with a cosy fan forced wood heater, the lounge is an ideal size for guests to gather or further mingle in the adjoining stylish kitchen. Electric cooking and plenty of cabinetry ensure this area functions well and is planned perfectly for the chef to intermingle whilst preparing the meals.
If crawling out of bed to take the children to school is a problem, then no more, with the reputable Clunes Primary School just across the way - an ideal home for a young family. A solid investment property with a rental return of: $190 per week. This home is a good buy in a good location, therefore be sure to arrange an inspection today.
Insights: 6 Cameron Street, CLUNES VIC 3370 was last sold in 2015 and 7 other 2 bedroom house in CLUNES have recently been sold.

Description:
Surprisingly Spacious on approx 3 acres
This one bedroom home plus study is surprisingly spacious in its design. The huge 7x4m lounge features a raked ceiling with free standing wood heating. An extra large open plan dining area creates good space for a dinner party with a split system for added comfort. Storage is plentiful in the full size kitchen and a very wide hallway leads to a generous bedroom. Outside has many options for use and would be ideal for self sufficiency or to run a few farm yard animals. Less than 30 minutes to Ballarat and Maryborough makes this property an easy commute.
Also includes:
Front & rear veranda
Semi circular drive
Single garage with remote control door
Carport suitable also for caravan or boat
Individual animal shelters plus dog run
Instantaneous lpg gas HWS
Town water plus tank & dam
Variety of fruit trees

Description:
Picture perfect 'Crabapple Cottage'
Presenting charm and character is this charming 2 bedroom plus study cottage. Wander through the beautifully maintained gardens or view through French doors opening onto a paved outdoor area to read a book or simply enjoy the sunny aspect this lovely space creates. Raised vegetable gardens make collection of fresh produce an easy task.
Features include combustion wood heating as well as a split system for year round comfort. Located within walking distance to Clunes historic main street and only a short walk to Clunes Health Service and Train Station. A must to inspect.
For further information please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301

Description:
Golden Gem In Heart Of Town
Cosy as can be, this quaint three bedroom home provides all the charm of an attractive country property. Warmed by inviting log fire with the further convenience of a split system, this home offers a further sunroom and a wide open full return veranda to soak up the rays, or cook the barby whilst looking over the land.
An open kitchen with walk in pantry and ample cupboard space provide plenty of storage facilities and ensure the central hub of the home is well stocked. Sliding doors to the outside deck/veranda provide easy catering access, whilst the family room is big enough to entertain friends day and night.
The hallway is elegantly decorated whilst the family bathroom is designed perfectly to service all three bedrooms.
With new carpets recently installed through the bedrooms and a lovely timber floor in the lounge, this home feels fresh yet snug throughout.
With the local shops just a short jog away, and with the advantage of the Clunes Primary just across the way, this property also offers close proximity to Mount Beckworth and commuting options to either Ballarat or Daylesford.
A lock up garage allows vehicle coverage off the street and the surrounding grounds are suitable for children or pets to play and exercise outside.

Description:
A Perfect Place To Call HOME
Just under 5 years old, this relatively new home provides a maintainable yard yet offers a generous 1359m2 to play with.
If you are looking at; running a few chickens, providing room for your loved pets, or building a large work shed (STCA), this home could be your answer.
Three bedrooms, two light filled living areas, modern kitchen and a fresh family bathroom, provide all the elements ready for good country living.
Electric hot water, gas and electric cooking, split system and wood heater supply all the fundamentals, whilst the quality fittings and fixtures compliment the clean lines and open space.
Finished with timber laminate floors, snug cosy carpet and fixed with built in robes, this home provides generous sized rooms and offer plenty of space for furniture arranging.
Filled with natural light, the kitchen meals area provides the essential hub to the home. Stainless steel appliances, ample cabinetry and designer qualities create a fabulous space to mix with friends and family or just chat over a cup of coffee.
A European laundry has been created to ensure there is plenty of room in the more central spaces, while external cupboards allow the bigger items to be stored away out of sight.
When thinking about the outdoors and its landscaping needs, you will find a 9000L water tank, which automatically switches to mains water when water gets low - a perfect solution for water saving costs and assurance that you won't be left with shampoo in your hair!
A single garage and carport provide off street parking whilst the raised undercover deck with caf blinds overlooks the wide open rural setting.
Clunes is a picturesque township; with quaint stores, vineyards, wineries and magnificent scenic walks and surrounds. Endowed with vintage stores, stunning natural surrounds and rich in history, this charming country town is in the heart of the Victorian goldfields and provides a short drive to Ballarat and just an hour and 20 minutes drive east to Melbourne.
Be sure to contact our agents for further information and inspection times.

Low maintenance garden makes this property an ideal weekender, permanent home or investment property.

High ceilings
Open plan living
French doors
Floating timber floors to living and carpet to bedrooms
Clear story windows for added light to living area
Free standing bath and separate shower

Description:
Vacant 4 acre land holding
Offering approx 4.3 acres of cleared land, this property is one of the last undeveloped land holdings in this quiet court. The property has a crossover installed and is fenced on all boundaries. Powers is passing and the property has sealed road frontage. Zoned low density residential, this is a value for money country block, only minutes drive to the centre of Clunes.
Phil Hayward : 0419 107 112

Description:
Cottage in Clunes on 989m2 block
This quaint 3 bedroom cottage located on the fringe of Victoria's first gold town has been well loved in its approx. 150 years. Timber flooring in front 2 bedrooms, hall and lounge compliment the character of the home. 3rd bedroom has been updated to incorporate a study area, or potentially 4th bedroom. Plenty of space in the kitchen/dining room and a charming window to look out over the sink makes washing dishes more appealing.
Mature roses line the front entrance, abundance or lemons and apricots from the established fruit trees and various old world cottage garden plants is everything you expect to find at a property of the 1800's era
Tucked in the back corner of the block is "The Studio". What you have is a little piece of Clunes history…
Located close to Clunes Health Service and Train Station. Inspection by appointment.
For further information please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301.

Description:
Fabulous Opportunity on Two Titles
With views across Mount Beckworth, this parcel of land is set on two titles. A fabulous flat allotment of 4860m2, in a most picturesque location, this gorgeous property has power and water available, and also a land capability assessment report , completely fenced and is situated on a convenient bitumen road. This definitive real estate is situated just minutes from the historic township of Clunes, where many quaint cottages and original shop fronts bursts warmth and character.
An ever increasing population, this area benefits from a quiet country lifestyle yet enjoys the amenities and facilities of nearby Creswick. Just 20 minutes to the city of Ballarat and an ideal scenic drive through to Daylesford. This purchase would not only provide an ideal space to perhaps graze a pony, it would also provide an opportunity to build (STCA), with two convenient titles in place. Take a drive today, cast your eye over the property and then call our informative staff for further details.

Description:
Affordable Lifestyle With Great Shedding
Set on approx. 3.66 acres or 1.481 ha in a beautiful, quiet street is this low maintenance home with modern comforts and the opportunity for self sustainability. Featuring an open plan kitchen, living and dining area with split system air conditioning and floating floor boards, main bedroom with built in robes and another air conditioner and double blinds throughout, this home is comfortable, cosy and easy to look after.
Externally, you will be very impressed with what is on offer. As you drive through the remote gates at the front you are greeted with established gardens and a choice of car spaces with a triple carport as well as a 12m x 12m shed with high clearance doors, concrete floor and power connected making it ideal for storing your toys or working from home. The home is connected to 12 solar panels on a 3kw system meaning little to no bills!
Further to this, the home is connected to town water but also has 3 x 3000 litre tanks and 2 x 9000 litre tanks for gardening and stock. For the hobby farmer, there are 2 stables and 2 holding yards with water to the large back paddock which also has a dam, 2 chook/duck pens, 2 garden sheds, a large orchard at the front with a variety of fruits and all with a watering system, shaded veggie patch area, hot house and the paddock has previously been ploughed and sowed with Rye grass which grew well and serviced the animals sufficiently.
There is a bungalow/storage room which would make ideal studio space or a guest room if you wish. This property has a little something for everyone and all of the hard work has been done. Priced so that it represents great value, be sure to inspect the property ASAP before you miss out!

Description:
Storybook home in Clunes
Immediately the garden presents as a spectacular display of shapes, textures and perfumes within attractive ardours and garden rooms. Set on a 1060m2 allotment, on the outskirts of Clunes, this idyllic property is a mesmerising mix of character and modern comforts.
From the moment you step through the front door, this Tudor inspired family home has a real sense of flair associated with its design.
The kitchen provides all the modern elements, with stainless appliances, ample cupboard space and a large open area to house a country kitchen table
The handsome yet cosy lounge showcases amazing natural stone floors and bold colours which are softened by the white French doors which take in the views from the relaxing veranda. Even a unique observation tower allows a 360 view over the township and district.
The family bathroom is embellished with etched doors which open up to the zen gardenroom beyond, a unique and sensual place whilst soaking in the claw foot bath.
Upstairs incorporates the bedrooms which have built in robes, a study nook and relaxing zone, ideal for children or guests, with plumbing connected if an ensuite was a preferred option. The stairs to the second level also provide ample storage space underneath.
The double garage is a matched facade which offers wide fold back doors, perfect to convert to further living space if desired.
This is real storybook home, with years of established plantings and unique delivery.
Only a tour, will provide the beauty of this wondrous home and garden.
Offering a rental return of $340 per week!
Call our agents today.

Description:
Snapshot of Yesteryear in Clunes
Rarely do opportunities, so rich in history, come about. Owned and occupied by the notable Lean family, this 1863 property will be marketed for sale. An astonishing 73 years of residency, this charming cottage endured the nurturing of eleven children.
With some original period features still in place; combustion oven & timber lined walls - this home is completely unique.
Set on a slightly sloping allotment and nestled amid the relics of yesteryear, this amazing feature filled' home has been reenergised to provide a modern twist to centuries of living. This typical miner's cottage has been restumped and rewired to provide a solid base, whilst the interior has had some work completed with the installation of a stunning Bellings induction stove, gas hot water and ample cupboard space; however there are still renovations to complete by the new owner. Whilst the laundry is currently housed within the family bathroom, this could be returned to its external shell with a little work, to provide further space inside and capture the original larder style laundry.
Fuelled by a cosy free standing wood heater plus benefitting from the convenience of a split system, this property of 1315m2 provides plenty of space and sheds to manage a large woodheap and tools for winter provisions. Drenched in abundance of times gone by', this property would create a quirky weekender or a quaint family home. Located within walking distance of the main street of Clunes and close to the local school, shops and public transport, this heritage listed property is a unique purchase. Ask our agents in Creswick to arrange an inspection; you will be delighted with the tour.

Description:
Dutch Cottage 'circa 1888'
Nestled in a pretty cottage garden behind the traditional picket fence you will find the 2 bedroom Dutch Cottage which has been beautifully renovated with the original period in mind, right in the heart of the historic township only a few paces from all that Clunes has to offer.
This light filled home has the characteristic wide hall with polished boards through out and generous north facing living space along with separate formal lounge. Gather with friends on the sunny entertaining deck or simply enjoy the sunshine while you read a good book.
Features include:
French doors to a decked entertaining area as well as from bedrooms to verandah
Open fire place as well as a wood heater and split system for year round comfort
Bathroom includes claw foot bath and separate shower
Separate laundry with 2nd WC
Easy care cottage garden
Carport and Studio shed
Original Blue Stone guttering
Located an hour and a half from Melbourne makes an easy drive to a lovely country getaway.
Inspection for the serious buyer by appointment only please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301

Description:
Central opportunity for home/business zoned Commercial 1
With excellent exposure this property is located at the Clunes township crossroads, currently tenanted and available for vacant possession. In need of love to bring out period features such as the ceiling roses and original Art Deco interior doors. Room use is versatile, either 2 bed, 2 living or 3 bed, I living or perhaps you prefer a formal dining or shop space. Walking distance to all that Clunes has to offer this location is ideal for the home business or investor. Lounge has lpg heating with potential to reinstate open fire place. Outside you will find a flourishing vegie patch with garden/storage shed, single garage, 2nd toilet and enclosed yard. Ripe for renovation!
For more information regarding this property please contact Jo Millar on 0438 081 301

Description:
Architecturally designed 1950's 3 Bedroom home on large corner block
Step through the front door into the wide entry and back to the 1950's of this original one owner family home. Enjoy the features of the original designer country kitchen with dishwasher and St George cooker, high ceilings with period ceiling roses, Axeminster carpet with underlyng polished timber boards & double glass doors opening from the formal dining room to a light filled lounge. This very solid home has stood the test of time. Situated on approx. 1580m2 is conveniently located within walking distance to the train station and the Clunes Campus of the Hepburn Health Service. With such a large land parcel, enjoy the space or take advantage of the potential for subdivision (STCA)
Also included:
Split system/Vulcan electric heater with option to reinstate open fire place
Electric hws
Enclosed yard
Established easy care garden
Single garage plus storage room and rear access
Views of surrounding hills
A must to inspect for the serious buyer

Description:
20 acres plus home - Priced to sell
If it's privacy and seclusion you want while only being minutes from town, you will love this quiet rural property.
Perfect for horses, bike riding, shooting, parties or just peace and quite, this two bedroom home offers distant views across the land and onto the hills.
Set kilometres from the iconic township of Clunes, in central Victoria, historically known as the first town where gold was discovered, this private residence, currently running sheep features;large shed/garage, carport, plus 20 acres divided into several paddocks.
Chicken coups, fruit trees, approx 33,600 lt water storage, solar panels totally off the grid and a composting toilet provide sustainable living and money saving options.
This delightful property is a blank canvas waiting for you to put your mark on it. A cosy kitchen with combustion stove and heater, dining living area, two bedrooms and central bathroom make this home the perfect weekender, or ideal for those setting their sights on a tree change.
This properties real advantage is the well cleared land, which provides the wide distant views and the opportunity to strike gold!
Call our agents today, to arrange an inspection and to take you through the benefits of this priced to sell' property. If you wish to drive past; turn into McLennans Rd, then left into Carter Rd and follow the pointers labelled with PRD.

Description:
Special opportunity overlooking the historic township of Clunes
Here is an outstanding opportunity that you shouldn't pass by. Located in the ever popular country town of Clunes in central Victoria, is this large parcel of land boasting several titles. In area, it measures approximately 16187m2, 1.68 HA or 4 acres. Comprising of multiple titles and three road frontages (entry via Whyte Street), this site would lend itself to development (STCA) and has several flat sites making life easy when planning to build your dream home, plus any additional shedding that is required. All services including power, water and sewerage are available for connection on each block site. With the land being offered today having been in one family for nearly a century, this is a once in a lifetime chance to plan your own country lifestyle, overlooking the township and reaping the benefits that are on offer.
Located only a short 30 minute drive to Ballarat and Maryborough, a few minutes walk to Clunes main street, Clunes Primary School and Wesley College are nearby. A secondary school bus provides transport into Ballarat if desired and the VLine train runs daily, with the towns station close by.
Clunes presents a very active community as seen by the many sporting and social club events it holds. Clunes is historically known as the first town where gold was discovered in 1851 by William James Esmond. Many historic building remain in the township such as, quaint cottage and original shop fronts bursting with character representing that era. Take the time to come out and enjoy the serenity surrounding Clunes.

Description:
Sweet Abode on Picturesque Hectare of Land
This delightful property is sure to win the hearts of those seeking a weekender or those chasing the lifestyle of a space and serenity. The property measuring just over two and a half acres is on the outskirts of town and is high set on top of rise taking in views across the countryside. The land offers great potential for extra shedding and gradually slopes down to a creek. The home is very comfortable with two generous bedrooms, a sunny living area and a functional kitchen. Come and enjoy a relaxed lifestyle or maybe bring a horse or two.
